name: Giant Elk
actions_desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.
special_abilities_desc: If the elk moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
description: On average these creatures stood 7 ft (2.1 m) tall at the shoulder and weighed around 1,500 lb (680 kg).[2]Giant elks fought other creatures with either their antlers or their sharp forehooves.[2]Like any species of deer, giant elks were typically found in forests with a temperate climate.[2]In the Border Kingdoms they could be found in the forest of Hawkgarth.[3] In the region of Kara-tur, they could be found in the forests of Akari island.[4]Many cultures considered it taboo to hunt these creatures.[1] They were often preyed upon by dire wolves and saber-toothed tigers.[5]These creatures were so rare that sightings were interpreted as foreshadowing some important event, like the birth of a future king. Some legends even spoke of deities manifesting on the Prime Material plane in the form of giant elks.[1]
caption: Giant elks, otherwise known as giant stags, were a rare species of larger than usual deer.
